contentrichtext.text: '''Celia Larkin''' is a former [[civil service of the Republic of Ireland|Irish civil servant]] and was the partner of then Irish [[Taoiseach]] (prime minister) [[Bertie Ahern]]. ==Relationship with Bertie Ahern== Their relationship ended in April 2003. Ahern is separated, though not divorced, from his wife. There was some controversy in the media at Ahern's public presentation of his partner. No other European Heads of Government have similarly presented their partner at official engagements. Ahern was accused of hypocrisy in being associated with a woman other than his wife while being a practising Massgoer. The media discovered the couple had broken up when Larkin failed to co-host a diplomatic dinner for the visiting German [[President of Germany|Bundespräsident]], although her name, along with that of the Taoiseach, was featured on the invitations. Various media reports <ref>Irish Independent, 28th Aug 05 [http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/stories.php3?ca=45&si=1458457&issue_id=12928]</ref> have suggested that Ahern has, since 2005, been in a relationship with his long time friend [[Anna Bogle]]. Larkin, during the period of her relationship with Ahern, regularly acted as his consort. She also occasionally engaged in civic functions in a private capacity. For example, she launched a high speed ferry, the [[M.V. Jonathan Swift]] for [[Irish Ferries]]. ==Other activities== Since parting with Ahern, she has expanded her chain of [[beauty salon]]s, and has appeared on [[Reality Television]], in an [[RTÉ]] show ''The Restaurant'', a more serene forerunner to the [[ITV]] series [[Hell's Kitchen (UK TV series)|Hell's Kitchen]]. In July 2005, Ms. Larkin was appointed to the board of the new National Consumer Agency, a Government funded [[consumer watchdog]]. Her appointment was reportedly made at Bertie Ahern's request.<ref>Irish Independent, 20th Jul 05 [http://www.unison.ie/irish_independent/stories.php3?ca=9&si=1435953&issue_id=12759]</ref> As of 2010, she is attending the [[University of Limerick]] as a mature student. == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.nytimes.com/2001/05/20/world/dublin-aflutter-over-party-featuring-premier-s-partner.html?pagewanted=1 "Dublin Aflutter Over Party Featuring Premier's Partner" - New York Times] * [http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/breaking-news/uk-ireland/celia-larkin-due-back-before-mahon-tribunal-today-13506790.html "Celia Larkin due back before Mahon Tribunal today" - Belfast Telegraph] * [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/northern_ireland/1330787.stm "Ahern in reception invitation row" - BBC News] * [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/northern_ireland/6991221.stm "Taoiseach begins giving evidence" - BBC News] * [http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2008/0603/1212365094186.html "Tribunal to question Celia Larkin on £30,000 loan" - Irish Times] * [http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2005/0719/1121682593331.html "Ahern nominates Celia Larkin to consumer body" - Irish Times] * [http://www.independent.ie/breaking-news/national-news/celia-larkins-aunt-moves-out-of-home-after-mahon-controversy-1296834.html "Celia Larkin's aunt moves out of home after Mahon controversy" - Irish Independent] * [http://www.herald.ie/national-news/celia-blanked-my-calls-for-her-to-go--eddie-1731493.html "Celia blanked my calls for her to go" - Herald] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Larkin, Celia | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Larkin, Celia}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bertie Ahern]] [[Category:Irish civil servants]] [[Category:Spouses and partners of Taoisigh]]
